humanum_full_description_en:
hieroglyph, like a bird flying its wings, the original meaning is the action of a bird flapping its wings in the air. "Shuowen": "Birds. Pictograms. All those who fly are from flying." "Poetryâ€§Beifengâ€§Swallows and swallows": "Swallows and swallows flew, and their feathers were missing from the pond." "Birds, I know they can fly." Li Bai, "Shu Dao Difficult": "Yellow cranes can't fly, but the apes want to save their worries and climb."

" Flying " can further refer to the aerial actions of animals and things other than birds. "YiÂ·Qian": "Flying dragon is in the sky." "XunziÂ·Encourage learning": "The snake flies without feet." Han Wudi Liu Che, "Autumn Wind": "Autumn wind rises, white clouds fly, yellow grass falls, and geese return south "Seven Lives" by Jin Zhang Association: "Furious and angry, Star Fei is shocked."

" Flying " can be extended to quickly spread and pass. Han Huan Kuan's "Salt and Iron Theory-Light and Heavy": "Transferring to the warehouse, the wealth of the treasury, to the border people." One of Jin Zuosi's "Epic Poems": "The frontier city is bitterly mingled, and the feather flies to Kyoto." Tang Hanyu "Feng Chou Zhenwu Doctor Hu Twelfth Zhang": "Flying across Yuzhan's mountain and dawning in the mountains, far away from Jin Kesaicaochun." Qing Hongsheng "Eternal Life Palace-Night Resentment": "Drunken moon flying, dreaming rain bed ."

" Fly " can also be used as an adverb, which means fast. "Three KingdomsÂ·Wu ShuÂ·LÃ¼ Meng Biography": "Flying book summons the monks, so that they will lay down the tombs, and urgently return them to help." "Peach Blossom Fan-Fubing": "Waiting for Jiangzhou army to fly down." Modern Chinese "Flying" "Flying" also uses this meaning.

" Fly " can also be used as an adjective to indicate groundlessness. "Heguanziâ€¢King of Wuling": "Widows hear Feiyu spread." The idioms still used today, "Russian Feiyu" (also can be written as "Russian Feiyu") and "Fei Short and Liu Long" come from this meaning.

hieroglyph, like a bird flying its wings, the original meaning is the action of a bird flapping its wings in the air. "Shuowen": "Birds. Pictograms. All those who fly are from flying." Li Bai, "Shu Dao Difficult": "Yellow cranes can't fly, but the apes want to save their worries and climb." " Flying" can further refer to the aerial actions of animals and things other than birds. "YiÂ·Qian": "Flying dragon is in the sky." "XunziÂ·Encourage learning": "The snake flies without feet." Han Wudi Liu Che, "Autumn Wind": "Autumn wind rises, white clouds fly, yellow grass falls, and geese return south "Seven Lives" by Jin Zhang Association: "Furious and angry, Star Fei is shocked." Tang Hanyu "Feng Chou Zhenwu Doctor Hu Twelfth Zhang": "Flying across Yuzhan's mountain and dawning in the mountains, far away from Jin Kesaicaochun." (1) (Birds, insects, etc.) stir their wings to move in the air.
(2) Generally refers to the actions of other creatures or objects in the air.
(3) Refers to flying insects or birds.
(4) The object is floating or flying in the air.
(5) The metaphor wanders everywhere.
(6) Ascend, rise.
(7) Refers to your ambition.
(8) You Benz.
(9) Scattered. Refers to objects scattered after flying away from the original place.
(10) Lost; escaped.
(11) Vibration.
(12) Propagate, spread.
(13) Rapid transmission or delivery.
(14) refers to shooting (arrows).
(15) Throwing.
(16) Waving.
(17) Splashing. See "Flying", "Flying".
(18) Refers to the strong wind blowing.
(19) Still indulgent and unrestrained.
(20) It means to grind mineral powder or pigment into powder and soak it in water to bleach off the coarse debris floating on the water.
(21) Refers to the appearance (blush) on the face. See "Fei Zhu", "Fei Hong".
(22) It is said that there is a flirtatious glance.
(23) Fast and fast.
(24) Coming out of thin air; unfounded. See "Feiyan", "Feige".
(25) Accidental. See "Flying".
